metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3713 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
An out-of-bounds write flaw was found in the UAS (USB Attached SCSI) deviceemulation of QEMU in versions prior to 6.2.0-rc0. The device uses the guestsupplied stream number unchecked, which can lead to out-of-bounds access tothe UASDevice->data3 and UASDevice->status3 fields. A malicious guest usercould use this flaw to crash QEMU or potentially achieve code executionwith the privileges of the QEMU process on the host.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3713` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.37
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.37
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.37
qemu-kvm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.37
qemu-system - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.37
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.37
qemu-system-common - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.37
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.37
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.37
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.37
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.37
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.37
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.37
qemu-user - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.37
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.37
qemu-user-static - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.37
qemu-utils - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.37
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: qemu package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.37').
